data.name: XUndoManagerListener
desc: implemented by components which want to be notified of changes in the Undo/Redo stacks of an Undo manager.
**since**
OOo 3.4

methods.name: actionRedone
desc: is called when the top-most action of the Redo stack has been re-applied.

methods.name: actionUndone
desc: is called when the top-most action of the undo stack has been undone.

methods.name: allActionsCleared
desc: is called when both the Undo and the Redo stack have been cleared from all Undo actions.

methods.name: cancelledContext
desc: is called when an Undo context has been left, but no actions have been added within this context.
In such a case, the context which has just been left will not contribute to the undo stack, but instead be silently removed. Consequently, the UndoManagerEvent.UndoActionTitle is empty.

methods.name: enteredContext
desc: is called when a new Undo context has been entered.
UndoManagerEvent.UndoActionTitle carries the title of the Undo context, and UndoManagerEvent.UndoContextDepth the number of open Undo contexts, including the one just entered.

methods.name: enteredHiddenContext
desc: is called when a new hidden Undo context has been entered.
UndoManagerEvent.UndoActionTitle carries the title of the Undo context, and UndoManagerEvent.UndoContextDepth the number of open Undo contexts, including the one just entered.

methods.name: leftContext
desc: is called when an Undo context has been left.
UndoManagerEvent.UndoActionTitle carries the title of the Undo context, and UndoManagerEvent.UndoContextDepth the number of open Undo contexts, excluding the one just left.

methods.name: leftHiddenContext
desc: is called when a hidden Undo context has been left.
UndoManagerEvent.UndoActionTitle is empty, as hidden Undo contexts don't have a title.

methods.name: redoActionsCleared
desc: is called when the Redo stack has been cleared.

methods.name: resetAll
desc: called when the complete undo manager has been reset

methods.name: undoActionAdded
desc: is called when an undo action is added to the undo stack.

Note that the action must not necessarily be the new top element of the stack: In case there's an open Undo context, UndoManagerEvent.UndoContextDepth will be greater 0, and the newly added action will be subordinate of the context action.
